name: Materials Advantage
description:
Welcome to the Material Advantage student chapter at TAMU! Our mission is to promote knowledge of materials science and engineering and all its sub-disciplines, to assist our members in their professional and academic endeavors, and to create closer ties between materials professionals and the TAMU student body.

What is the advantage?

Learn about the exciting opportunities and research going on in Materials Science and Engineering!

Meet diverse speakers and professional contacts from academia and industry!

Travel to professional society meetings and lab tours, compete to win prizes in poster symposia, and improve your 'soft skills' with a variety of competitions!

$30 annual membership fees gets you: 

  • Access to $800,000 in scholarships and discounted conference fees
  • Lower insurance rates
  • Automatic membership to the 4 professional materials societies

ACerS - The American Ceramic Society

AIST - Association for Iron & Steel Technology

ASM International - The Materials Information Society

TMS - The Minerals, Metals and Materials Society 

How to get involved?

  • Officer positions available (undergraduate and graduate welcome).
  • Events posted periodically on maroonlink and email 
  • To be a member in the international chapter, please go to http://materialadvantage.org/ and choose Texas A&M University as the local chapter.

"Everything else is immaterial!"
summary: Material Advantage provides members with the technical and professional skills they need to be superior materials scientists and engineers
